column5: Yup!!!  Its sausage patty nite for me tonite!!
great read and great pics congrads wish i was there.....  Hawg Hunyrt
Great report there is nothing better then spending time with good friends and to get a deer and moose makes it that much better  Rob
Man you guys are livin' the Good Life!

Very noice TJ!  You're only missing the celebratory shot of the bull's head strapped to the hood of your car...  That would have been the icing on the cake!  MERDE STI.  Mon congelateur pese rien cette annee!  Ben joue mon grand.  HD
awesome report again Boss I always look forward to this report even as a non hunter I love this report you sure have a great life up there congrats on it Tj.
Congradulations on your sucessful hunt. I enjoyed your post very much.
Poor animals..What did they ever do to you?Exept taste good.Great job,good story and nice pics. Joe
That reminds me Joey.I have a zip lock bag of alpaca hair that I forgot to bring to Lakair.PM me your address and I'll mail it to you...or stalk you. Joe

great report T.J i wish I had known you were up there or i would have stopped in at the cabin although after looking at the table i am maybe glad i didn't know nice buck and bull you guys got by the way if you ever get up here in the summer that point in the first pic holds tonsof smallies (at least it did this summer and last) those wolf tracks are common there on that beach ...we were ice fishing of that pointa couple of winters ago and had six timbers come out on to the ice from near the cabin..one was a beautiful black one hope to meet up with you next time you come up there you should come up in the summer and do some pre season scouting would love to show you and monique the area and enjoy some great fishing  rick
Thanks for the great report and pics TJ. This is one of the reports I look forward to every year.  Congrats to your group on a successful season.
looks like a great time for sure, congrats to you and your group on a successful outing.  looks like beautiful country up there.  jason
Awesome Report TJ
NICE!!!!!!!!!mmmmmmmm moose burgers!!!!!!!!

Great, NO EXCELLENT report. I always LOVE the pictures you guys post here. This has to be the #1 report IMHO ! ! !  Now about that .300 Savage. That gun is a Savage Model 99 lever action that is probably worth some nice coin if you didn't know already. I have one in a .243 Win that is in MINT condition. Depending on the condition of that model 99 and it's serial number it could even be a collectors item. Here is a site that can answer all that. Not many guns have there own sites but the Savage Model 99 is a really sought after firearm from the past.  http://www.24hourcampfire.com/ubbthreads/u...Board/40/page/1
Enjoyed that very much TJ.  Thanks.  Good luck with a buck next year.
Nice pics. That pin-up girl is a hottie.
Great job Tj, Nice to see the young ones getting in on the hunting.
Thanks for the report TJ!!  Congrats to the new guy on baggin his first buck!!  Sinker

TJ that was a great report! Looks like you fellas know how to have a good time. Congrats on the young lads Trophy Buck. I remember being so happy when my son got his first one. Words cannot describe the feeling. I bet the drive home wasn't quite so bad this year.

Great hunt TJ    Love the pitctures and smiling faces, and most important the comeraderie this goes with one of our oldest heritages, I fought fires near Fort Frances in an area buy Cuttle lake if thats familial back in 1979 80 regarding the blood and gore it just looks like your average day in the Jane and Finch area

LOL... thanks for all the comments guys/girlz.  I wish everyoine could do it... its quite addicting..  all these new hunting posts only remind me its over... boo hoo...  (perhaps I can slip up to camp for one last weekend.... hmmmm.....
Nice report TJ, just looking at all that Deer and Moose meat is making my mouth water, good job  :clapping:

Awesome report TJ, one of these days I'll get my butt in gear and take a course (I'm thinking of the archery/crossbow one first) but time is what I have very little of nowadays.  Posts like those always get me thinking about it.  Thanks for sharing,  Stan
Great Report TJ.  Congrats to your friends first deer!

Great report and pictures.  Sounds like you have a great group to hunt/share stories with, which to me is more important than any trophy.  Congrats to Nicholas and to his dad and the group for passing on the hunting heritage.  Already having trouble waiting for the weekend to get together with my hunting group, you just made it alot worse.  I guess I can just look at some more satellite maps of my area again.  Thanks for sharing and enjoy the memories and fine eating ahead.
Yeah you were right about the graphic nature of the poster! KEEERIPES!       So when is the Moose BBQ?

Oh the favoratism     Guess my homemade bucktail spinnerbaits aren't worthy     None for you then  Great report TJ.  You had me freaked out there for a minute as my uncle's name is Bob Burnham.  But he looks like nobody in your pics so must not be him.  I coulda done without the poop pic too btw  Joey
Joey... did ya want some tails.... Ill see if I can come up with some for ya!!
Excellent, Nicholas is hooked now . Nice Buck. I sure  Dad will be proud.  Looks like you's did not get any of the snow.  Great report of another sucessful harvest. I got the fever.
Sweet!!!  That would be awesome TJ.  I'm running out of them faster than a bottle of whisky at a moose hunt camp  Thanks bud.  Joey
great report  but I seem to be lost if you had it in a truck why did you then need to put it in a boat
They had to show it off to the nieghbours  Very EXCELLENT REPORT. Congrats to all.
wow looks like a PILE of fun! Thanx for the report TJ..!  Hawk
wow looks like on wicked time.

The pics in the cutting room sure do bring back memories of the Soo TJ. There would be 5-6 of us carving, cutting and blending and stuffing 200lb. lbs of sausage. All done  while washing down a couple of gallons of homemade wine. Me being the new member of the party got to dig in and mix the sausage blend by hand. Right up to my elbows. Had to blend in a little bit of pork so the sausage didn't get too dry. Half would go in the freezer, the other half packed in oil to become cured dry sausage.
It's always the rookie who scores isn't it? LOL! Looks like a fantastic trip T.J., traditions are important.
It was shot on the udderside of the lake, so's in order to hang it up pruperly like we hads to bring er 'ome
